questions.question: What is the coordination number of a face-centered cubic (FCC) crystal structure?

explanations.c: FCC structures have 12 nearest neighbors for each atom, hence a coordination number of 12.

questions.question: What is the packing efficiency of a body-centered cubic (BCC) crystal structure?

explanations.a: BCC structures have a packing efficiency of approximately 68% due to less dense atomic arrangement compared to FCC.

questions.question: If the atomic radius in a face-centered cubic (FCC) crystal is 'r', what is the edge length of the unit cell?

explanations.d: The edge length of an FCC unit cell is calculated as 4r/√3 based on the diagonal relationship in the cubic geometry.

questions.question: Which of the following crystal structures has the highest packing efficiency?

explanations.d: Hexagonal close-packed (HCP) and FCC structures have the highest packing efficiency of 74%, higher than simple cubic or BCC.

questions.question: What is the Miller index of a plane that cuts through the x-axis at 1a, the y-axis at 2a, and the z-axis at ∞?

explanations.a: The reciprocals of intercepts are taken to find the Miller indices: 1/1, 1/2, and 1/∞ result in (1 2 0).

questions.question: In a body-centered cubic (BCC) crystal structure, how many atoms are effectively contained within one unit cell?

explanations.b: BCC contains 1 atom at the center and 1/8th of each of the 8 corner atoms, effectively summing to 2 atoms per unit cell.
